.
Restoring the Award if the Marriage Is Dissolved
Use the table below to determine when to restore an award if the marriage of a child deemed permanently incapable of self-support is dissolved.
If the marriage of a child deemed permanently incapable of self-support was terminated by death or divorce …
Then benefits payable to or for the child …
prior to November 1, 1990
can be restored.
Note
:  The instruction in this cell assumes VA determined the child’s incapacity for self-support
did not cease during the period of marriage, and
will not cease in the future.
Reference
:  For more information on the marriage of a child deemed permanently incapable of self-support that was terminated by death or divorce prior to November 1, 1990, see
38 CFR 3.55(b)(2)
, and
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 3.C.2
.
on or after November 1, 1990
cannot be restored after marriage unless the marriage is
annulled, or
determined to be void.
Reference
:  For more information on criteria necessary to restore benefits, see
38 CFR 3.55(b)(1)
.
